runs.comm: length ball outside off, left alone
short of a length, around off, defended off the back foot
pushes at a wide length ball that goes with the angle and beats the edge
flamboyant pull shot. This is not even short enough, he just moves across, and plays the short-arm swivel-pull with the front leg in the air
looks to work this to leg from outside off, and gets a leading edge towards point
length ball outside off, allowed to angle through to the keeper
on a length, on off, defended back to him
on a length, on off, hits the inside half of the bat
short of a length, angling away, left alone
seams away from short of a length and around off. Left alone
this one seams back in and beats the inside edge, but is bouncing over

he has shown him all the stumps by moving across, is hit on the pad, and goes for a leg-bye. The throw hits Beregner and wrong-foots Rossouw who is backing up. Ali, who doesn't know it has hit Berenger begins taking the overthrow. Berenger has no option but to go through. Rossouw is complaining even though Berenger is sort of apologising suggesting he couldn't do anything once his partner had come all the way up to the striker's end. Rossouw has no business showing righteousness. You are allowed to run off the body. Berenger has apologised too
defended to mid-off
pushes at a wide length ball, gets a thick edge over the slips for four
defended off the front foot
beautiful outswinger as this dips on him, just outside off, and then beats the outside edge
swinging in this time, appeal for lbw, but it is headed down leg
defended from the crease after moving across the stumps
Berenger has no clue about it. On a length, just outside off, and then seams away to beat the edge
on a length, just outside off, this time he is right behind it in defence
slight seam movement back in, goes for a leg-bye
move across the line, gets a faint inside edge that saves him from lbw to a straight delivery
stays on that Test length and line. Just short of the driving length, just outside off. Defended
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
full, on the pads, asking to be hit, which Ali does past midwicket
full, just outside off, defended from the crease
length ball outside off, defended with an open face
full outside off, defended solidly
Ali gives this length ball an almighty swing, and gets a thick edge for a single to third man
defended off the back foot
moves across to a length ball and picks it up over square leg for four
short of a length, worked towards short fine where Morkel msfields. They risk the second as Behardien throws at the non-striker's end. And then de Villiers misfields to let through an overthrow too
on a length, on off, defended
on a length, on off, defended
moves across and misses. Is hit on the pad right in front but it is carrying over the stumps
no-ball now. Berenger defends one to cover
well bowled. Sees him back away and bowls on the tram line. Oh hold on, that's a harsh call on the wide. Steve Davis is the umpire
moves away from the stumps, Philander stays wide outside off, he can barely reach it, and ends up playing it back to the bowler
short of a length, angling in, runs this down to third man for one
good bouncer. Called one for the over. Pretty accurate with line, and sharp with pace. Berenger ducks it
fuller, beats his inside edge, hits him on the pad. The ball is headed down leg

a lovely catch by Rossouw. Superb fielding. Morkel bowls the Morkel length, gets it to rise towards the chest. Berenger fends. The ball hits the handle and lobs up towards where gully would be. Rossouw comes in from point and dives to his left, his wrong side, to swoop under the ball at the last moment before it can hit the ground
again the Morkel length. Just outside off, rising chest high. Left alone
wide length ball, allowed to go through to the keeper
on a length, seams away, takes the edge, goes past the second slip
full, just outside off, pushed to point
on a length, on the pads, clipped away
full, just outside off, driven down the ground, de Villiers makes a superb save from short straight cover
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
moves across the line to turn this off-stump delivery into a leg-side length ball. Whips it past midwicket for a single
short of a length, angling in, beats the inside edge to hit him just outside the line of off
beauty. Holds its line outside off to beat the outside edge as he plays the angle of the delivery
bouncer this time. Shorter than that Morkel length. Easier to leave it alone
looks for a pick-up shot after moving across the line, is beaten, and draws a half appeal for lbw. Bouncing over
short of a length, holds its line outside off, but too wide to make him play
bouncer this time, angling into him. He ducks under it. Maiden over
short to start off with, and he is punched away between point and cover  for four
again he is short, but is lucky that the shot finds the cover-point fielder
short again, and he is punished this time. Cut away between cover-point and cover
full, into the pads, clipped away in front of square for a couple
short again, and this time Khurram finds the man at backward point. Could easily have been 18 runs off the over so far
flighted on off, pushed to mid-off
on a length, outside off, played with an open face to point
short of a length, quick, hits the inside half of the bat, goes for a single
wide length ball, opens the face, gets a single to third man

crack. Into the helmet. That is awkward bounce from the Morkel length. Morkel goes to check on Khurram after hitting him in the helmet. This has reared up from just short of a length. KK takes his eye off it. Hit on the helmet
hits him again. This one doesn't go head high, but gets him on the glove. About chest high. KK takes his eye off and throws up his hands in self defence. Lucky for him that it doesn't lob up
he will be thankful this is outside off, and can leave it alone
flat length ball, defended
plays the reverse sweep, keeps it down, finds short third man
forward-defensive now

Duminy has got a wicket with a nothing delivery. This is full, and on the pads, and can be hit anywhere. Ali wants to go over short fine leg, but is early into the sweep, and gets a top edge that settles with deep square leg
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot
offbreak turning in towards top of off. Defended off the front foot
and he tries the fuller ball after setting the field for the bouncer. Khurram pushes from the crease, but doesn't get the edge
on a length again, outside off, and left alone

this was on the cards, although not through this method. Khurram c de Kock b Morkel was quite predictable after that last over but this has come through the bottom edge. Khurram sees one short, has had enough of fending, and goes for the pull. This one, though, doesn't bounce, and takes his underside edge through to the keeper
short of a length, just outside off, rears up high and leaves him too. Beats the outside edge
bouncer, just outside off, he ducks it. This spell from Morkel is just too good for these inexperienced batsmen
tries the yorker, but this is a bit too full, and is kept out well. Wicket-maiden
short of a length, off the pads, worked away for a single
floated outside off, defended to cover
that sight screen goes green just as Duminy lets this ball go. Patil does well to defend it okay
forward-defensive
turning in towards middle and leg. Defended
forward-defensive to end the over. Not sure he would have been looking for a single that would bring him back to strike
holds its line outside off to beat the edge
holds its line again, Anwar good enough top edge it to third man for one
length ball outside off, defended to cover
bouncer, just outside off, easily avoided
fuller, on off, defended to mid-on
full, and his aggressive field means there is no mid-off. Anwar pushes this through that area for a couple
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
on a length, outside off, played off the back foot with an open face
fuller, clipped to short midwicket
wide outside off, and called rightly so
length ball outside off, pushes it, can't beat cover
another wide outside off
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, gets a single
toppie first up, hits him on the pad, but is headed down leg
low full toss, driven to long-off
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
already a googly, defended off the front foot as this is too full
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
another googly, overpitched again, and defended easily
short of a length, holds its line outside off and beats the outside edge
full, on off, defended to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, sneaks under his attempt at a cut
full, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
good call by Steve Davis. This has pitched middle and seamed and beaten the batsman down leg, but the batsman has shuffled across. Good call to not signal a wide
accurate length ball, defended back
low full toss, pushed to long-off for one
flighted outside off, pushed to long-off for another single. Another overpitched googly
tossed up, middle and leg, defended back to him
nice dip on this legbreak, defended back to him
low full toss, driven to long-off for one
proper legbreak, defended off the front foot
wide length ball, driven to deep cover
holds its line outside off to beat the outside edge
length ball outside off, pushed wide of mid-on for one
dances down the wicket, slight swing in beats his shot and hits him on the pad
bottom edge on this square cut. Hits de Kock's pads on the bounce
on a length outside off, defended off the front foot
slight dip on this flighted legbreak, hits the cue end of his bat
defended off the front foot as Tahir goes legbreak again
another legbreak, but too full and too straight. Driven to long-on
full outside off, hit towards long-off for one
overpitched, driven down the ground, but not wide enough of Tahir
long hop, pulled away to the left of Amla at deep square, and he misfields to let a boundary through
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
another bottom edge on the cut, this time he squeezes it through the keeper's legs
short of a length, into the pads, but he can't get it far enough of the keeper
on a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
length ball outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, outside off, punched away for a single
full and straight, clipped away nicely. This is an excellent shot from Anwar. Beats the man in the deep on the on side
full, on off, wrists this to short straight midwicket
full and quick, just outside off, defended from the crease
he has lost this delivery completely. He has made an early decision to duck it but the ball is not nearly short enough. Hits him in the arm
that's a proper bouncer, and this time Anwar has played well by dropping the wrists and getting out of its line
looks to pull but is clearly slow into the shot. Mis-hits it to midwicket
short of a length, seams back in to beat him, but it is headed over the stumps
seams back in again, but once again bouncing over the stumps
short, but nowhere near as quick as Steyn and he makes room, clears the front leg and pulls this over midwicket for four
fuller, but into the pads, and is worked away for a single
full outside off, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, defended
full, just outside off, nicely punched away to cover
full outswinger, defended to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
full, into the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
digs this in short, just outside off, he drops his wrists and lets it through
another short one, but it starts a shade outside off and angles further away. Easy to stay away from it
short of a lemngth, he looks to pull, but mis-hits it to mid-on
that's too good from Philander. This one seams back in from just outside off without any indication it is going to move. Beats him all ends up, but the ball sails over the stumps
lovely shot. Down the wicket and also makes room and drives this length ball disdainfully and wide of mid-off
bouncer, he ducks it. Predictable response from a fast bowler who has been charged at last ball
this is excellent batting from Anwar. Gives Philander the charge again, gets under a length ball and goes straight back over the bowler's head
bouncer again as response, keeps the pull down, but hits it straight to mid-off
wide length ball, runs off the outside edge to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, rears up, outside off, left alone
bouncer this time. A proper bouncer that rises dangerously. He sways out of its line, and it goes sailing over de Kock's head for four byes
full, pushed straight of mid-off, which is wide, and gets a single
short of a length, harmlessly wide outside off, and left alone
legbreak, flat, pushed to cover
too straight, swept away fine for four fine of fine leg
looks to muscle this down the ground, hits it back to Tahir
down the wicket to drive this googly to long-off
looks to push this to long-on, but can't AB at short straight midwicket
finally beats somebody with what is quite an obvious googly. It is turning too far down leg, though, for him to get a leg-before decision
short of a length, angling in, tucked away off the hip for a single
holds its line in front of off, defended off the front foot
on a length, angling in towards top of off, defended from the crease
short ball, angling in towards his ribs, he does well to get inside its line
full and straight, worked past midwicket for a single
on a length, pushed with an open face. This is a no-ball
looks to clear his leg and swing to leg. Morkel bowls that Morkel length and hits him in the ribs. That hurts
driven to long-off for one
googly again, defended to leg
googly again, dips on him to beat him in flight. Defended off the front foot
swept away to deep midwicket for one
turned around the corner on the leg side
another slog-sweep from Anwar but this time finds deep midwicket with it. UAE's best batsman this tour has departed
short of a length, into the pads, worked around the corner
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, on off, pushed to midwicket
short of a length, angling across, beats his attempt to run it fine to third man
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
steers this down to third man for one
full, on off, no turn, defended back to him
googly, he doesn't pick it, beaten on the outside edge
defended off the front foot again
reverse-sweeps it over point for four
on a length, legbreak, played with the turn for a single
googly, pushed to short midwicket
short of a length, wide, cut away to third man for one
full, on off, pushed towards short straight midwicket
wide outside leg
gets an outside edge as Patil closes the face a little. Goes for a single to third man

Rossouw is everywhere, and de Villiers has another international wicket. Haider tries to pull, gets a top edge, Rossouw charges in from deep midwicket, and dives forward to get his hands under this low offering
pulled away to deep square leg for one
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
flighted on off, defended off the front foot
legbreak, defended off the front foot
down the wicket to drive this to long-off
googly, into the pads, easy to pick, worked around the corner for one
another googly going down leg
lebgreak this time, defended after leaving the crease
pulled down the ground, only inches wide of the outstretched left hand of AB

a wicket with a bouncer. AB will never let Morkel and Styen hear the last of this. Javed goes for the pull, gets a top edge, substitute Parnell nearly drops it trying to catch it overhead, but controls it on fifth grab and then juggles it a little for his own and crowd's entertainment. Completes the catch on the eighth attempt
AB stays short, this one doesn't come up, and Patil has pulled it through midwicket for four
short of a length, angling in, tucked away for a single
makes room and swings, mis-hits it to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
he clears the front leg and slogs. In the wrong post code, though
he has ducked into a bouncer and headed it over the keeper's head for four leg-byes. Not sure why a team should get runs for this
he swings like it is the 70s, but is beaten by a decade
bouncer, and he swings again, and misses again
oh nothing like a good old tailender having tailend swishes. This time he gets enough bat on a full ball to beat the man at cover
that's a sharp outswinger and from just short of a length. Patil looks to open the face, and is beaten
low full toss, nicely clipped away off the toes for a four through square leg
on the pads again, this time he takes the single to bring Naveed back to the striking end
backs away and swings, gets a lovely edge over the slips for four. This is proper classic tailend batting
lovely shot. Top-order  batsmen will be proud of this. He backs away,. Steyn follows him but bowls length. Naveed has swung this straight out of the crews for a massive six over wide long-on
and where has this leave come from? Steyn pushes this up and wide outside off, and Naveed for a change lets it be
on a length, angling in, hits the shoulder of the bat as Patil defends
short of a length, angling in, dropped to leg for one
I like how Naveed is still going for it. Makes room and swings. Beaten. It's a no-ball too
and he has bowled a wide outside off
he has hit it to the moon and back off this top edge and gets a single off the free hit
short of a length, rising in towards the chest, gets a bottom edge onto the pad
hits the shoulder of the bat with one pitched short of a length
that's a nasty bouncer. Seaming back in too. He has just about managed to get out of its way
flat ball, looks to cut, is beaten
and suddenly he is looking to bat like a proper batsman. Turns this full ball around the corner for one. Booooo
googly, missing leg again
another googly, driven against the turn, Amla fields superbly at cover, saving three with the dive
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, defends it back to him
outside the crease again, gets a single to long-on
short of a length, tucked around the corner for one
bouncer, this time he manages a top edge that doesn't go into no man's land. De Villiers completes the catch at midwicket. An entertaining cameo comes to an end
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, angling in, worked away around the corner
on a length, on off, played with an open face, gets a single
angling in, he bunts it into the leg side for a single
full and fast and outside leg, directs it fine for a couple
down the wicket to drive this back to Tahir
down the wicket, beaten in the flight as Tahir drags it back. Defended
googly, going down again
down the wicket, this time also makes room, and drives him over the head of extra cover for four
googly, a wide down the leg side
another googly, beats him, hits him on the pad, but is headed down leg again
Tauqir not fancying staying behind the line. Defends in front of the body even though the ball is pretty straight
opens the face and gets a single, and off the strike he goes
wide length ball, pushes it towards deep point where a misfield lets them come back for the second. Duminy, who fails to control the ball on the slide
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to deep point for one
tries the bouncer, but is well wide of off. Tauqir tries the cut, but is beaten
this time Tauqir sees this sail outside off without attempting a shot
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover
flat ball, Patil moves across and ramps this for a couple
googly, into the pads, defended to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
googly, overpitched, worked towards short midwicket where AB misfields to allow them a single
low full toss, driven to long-off
length-ball outswinger, Tauqir doesn't get behind it, is beaten, and the off stump is missed by inches
short of a length, just outside off, this time he defends
bouncer, outside off, easy to see off
short of a length, outside off, looks to cut is beaten
this is a bouncer at his body, and he has to sway away to avoid it
full and straight, and he gets the bat down in time to keep it out
short of a length, at the stumps, defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
tucks him up, works this around the corner for one
more short-pitched bowling, and this one flies off the arm guard for four leg-byes
another bouncer, and Tauqir is under it
looks to pull this shortish delivery angling across him, and is beaten
outswinger, on a length, beats the set batsman
on a length again, Patil stays back to defend
defends from the crease as Steyn pitches on a length

fifty for Patil who has surely been a thorn in the SA side, who want to get off the park as soon as possible. Pulled wide of deep midwicket, Tauqir slips while taking the second, but Steyn fails to gather the throw
edged off the shoulder of the bat, gets a single to third man
finally they get a wicket. Finally they attack the stumps. Tauqir backs away to swing. And Steyn hits the top of middle for his first wicket today
makes room, gets under s shortish delivery and punches it back over Morkel's head. The first boundary off his bowling
short outside off, beats Patil's attempt to cut. De Kock dives to his right to save byes
on a length, angling in, defended back to him
makes room to loft a length ball back over Morkel's head. Not getting much bat on them but he is going back over his head where there are no fielders
on a length, straight, defended with an open face
digs this in short, Patil gets under it, Shahzad will be on strike next over
Shahzad also loves to swing then. Plays at this way away from the actual line of the ball
swings again, cues it to mid-on on the bounce
it's all over as Shahzad backs away and swings again and lobs it to mid-on
